subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=39|rad=子|as=13|sn=16|four=77407|canj=HBND|ids=⿱𦥯子}}

subSections.title: Chinese
subSections.text: {{zh-forms|s=学|alt=斆,斅,斈,⿳⿰⿰丨丨丰冖子}}

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
Ancient forms: {{zh-l|*斆}}, {{zh-l|*斅}}. The former is constructed from the skeleton of {{zh-l|敎/教|to teach}} with the addition of two extra components: 1) a {{zh-l|*𦥑}} component around the top-left {{zh-l|*爻}} part, in this case signifying mingling hands (''[[hands-on]] learning''); 2) a {{zh-l|*冖|cover}} over {{zh-l|*子|child}}, representing the cover of a building or school, i.e. the child learns in a roofed place. ''{{w|Shuowen}}'' regards {{zh-l|*𦥑}} as the phonetic component in the character, which may be true according to some Old Chinese reconstructions such as that of {{w|Pan Wuyun}}'s, though probably not others. See {{zh-l|*教}} for more. The earliest structure may suggest its relationship with {{zh-l|*六}}, with reconstruction *rug.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: May be an endopassive derivation of {{och-l|覺|to awake, get insight}}.

Usage notes

* Chữ Nôm. The modern Vietnamese equivalent is [[học]].
* This is the regular form of the character. The common form is [[学]].
